speaker: Frasier
text: Well, listeners, flu season is upon us again.  As is customary, KACL is offering its employees and their families free flu shots.  Now, in order to show the importance of getting a flu shot, I am going to put aside my lifelong fear of needles and be inoculated right here over the air when we come back.  [_Frasier presses a button as Martin and Daphne enter._]

speaker: Martin
text: We've been sitting out here half an hour, I've got places to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dr. Claman is on his way, dad.

speaker: Roz
text: [_enters booth_] Frasier, are you afraid of needles?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not really, no.  I just say that to encourage people that really are.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, they can use the help.  You know, those needles they use are about this long [_uses finger to show great length_] and if it hits a nerve when it's going into the muscle... [_Frasier squirms_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Shots are perfectly harmless.  You've got nothing to worry about.  Well, sure, you hear the occasional story about somebody getting an air bubble in their vein or the needle getting stuck in a bone and the tip breaking off - but that's the exception.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's it!  We're out of here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what about my flu shot?  I always get a flu shot!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you're not getting a flu shot today, you told me you'd drop me off at McGinty's.  Now, I told Duke I'd meet him at five 'o clock sharp and he'd pounce if I were not there on time.  He sits there with his bottom lip stuck out and eats all of the Brazil nuts out of the bowl because he knows I like them!  So, come on, let's go.  [_Martin drags Daphne out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice to know that men in bars still settle their disputes the old fashioned way, isn't it?  [_Dr. Claman enters.  Roz is obviously taken aback by him as usual._]

speaker: Claman
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dr. Claman.

speaker: Claman
text: Sorry I'm late.  My last patient was a bleeder.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] Oh...

speaker: Roz
text: Fifteen seconds.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where are my manners? [_to Roz_] Perhaps you should be inoculated first.

speaker: Roz
text: I already had my shot. [_seductively to Claman_] But I could sure use a checkup! [_to Frasier_] You're on.  [_Roz exits to her booth._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_presses button_] All right, folks, we're back.  Em, joining us for this last minute of our show is Dr. Morris Claman who's going to give me my flu shot.  Uh, but, you know, what's the rush?  Perhaps we'd be interested in finding out what strains of flu you've isolated this year.

speaker: Claman
text: Primarily Singaporian and Guatemalan, would you roll up your sleeve, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: And how do you suppose they travelled here?

speaker: Claman
text: No idea.  Roll up your sleeve.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rolling sleeve_] Could it have been a careless tourist?  A baggage handler?  A tainted wok?

speaker: Roz
text: Dr. Crane, we're almost out of time.  You do want to get that shot, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_no, no_] Yes, yes.

speaker: Claman
text: Right, first I'm just gonna swab the area with a little alcohol and then I'm going to give you the shot. [_swabs it_] There, that's done.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, that didn't hurt at all.  The newly immunised Dr. Frasier Crane, signing off.  [_Frasier presses a button as Dr. Claman takes a big needle from his bag._]

speaker: Claman
text: No, no, no, that was just the alcohol.  This is the needle.  [_Frasier turns round and comes face to face with it, letting out a huge scream as Claman goes to inject him that causes Roz to jump and tear off her headphones._]  **DESIGNS**  [_Scene Two - Caf e Nervosa. The Cafe is busy when Frasier and Roz enter to meet Niles._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you're late.  All the tables are taken.

speaker: Roz
text: No, uh-er, there's one right there.  Dibs on that table.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Niles was here first.

speaker: Roz
text: No, but I'm meeting someone.  Please, guys?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, who is it?  Another one of your till-dawn-do-us-part relationships?

speaker: Roz
text: No, twerp!  It's a guy who I think really has a chance.  I can sense a lot of chemistry between us.  [_Dr. Claman enters and greets them._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!  When did you two even get out of my sight?!

speaker: Roz
text: You blanked out for thirty seconds after he gave you the shot!  [_Roz and Claman go to a table._]

speaker: Niles
text: No-one is budging, we're going to be here forever.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, I suppose we could share a table.  There's a couple of seats available there.  [_Frasier points out the window seat where two women are sat chatting._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, good Lord, we can't sit with strange women.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why not?  We married strange women! [_they laugh_]

speaker: Niles
text: But really, I'm not in the mood.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, just try to relax.  It'll do you good to do something spontaneous for a change.

speaker: Niles
text: I just... I just... I wouldn't know what to say.  And besides, I'm a married man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, please, when will you get rid of that tired old excuse - your off again/off again relationship with Maris?  [_Frasier and Niles go to the table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, ladies, excuse me, would you mind terribly if we joined you until another table opens us?

speaker: Laura
text: Oh, please do!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you so much, that's very kind. [_sits beside Laura_] I'm Frasier and... [_looks at Niles dusting his chair_] and this gentleman dusting for fingerprints is my brother, Niles. [_Niles sits_]

speaker: Laura
text: I'm Laura, and this is Beth.  [_They all greet each other._]  [_N.B. Lisa Darr and Peri Gilpin were both regulars on the short-lived TV series, "Flesh n' Blood."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: So... what do you two ladies do?

speaker: Beth
text: Er, you don't want to hear about it.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, why don't we?

speaker: Laura
text: It's just boring - to guys, anyway.

speaker: Beth
text: Yeah, their eyes just glaze over when the subject comes up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, come on.  We're not your average bozos off the street.  Why don't you try us?

speaker: Laura
text: [_resigned_] We design kitchens.  [_The brothers gasp in awe._]

speaker: Frasier
text: On the contrary!  I am always ready to debate the merits of downdraft cook tops and ceramic tile backsplashes.

speaker: Laura
text: Whoa!  Whose little boy are you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and just the mention of a double-bowl stainless steel sink with integral drain boards makes me hum like a sub-zero freezer!  [_Beth and Laura are just as surprised and delighted as the boys._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I think the key to a good kitchen is comfort.

speaker: Beth
text: Well, that's a whole current trend - a living room feel in the kitchen.

speaker: Niles
text: Except of course with our father, who favours a kitchen feel in the living room!  [_Everyone laughs, especially Beth._]

speaker: Beth
text: That's funny!  You're very witty. [_bats her eyes at him_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_embarrassed_] Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh look, Niles, a table has opened up. [_starts to get up_]

speaker: Laura
text: Oh, no, no, don't!  Stay.

speaker: Beth
text: Yeah, this is fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, it is fun, isn't it, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I told you it would be.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll go get us some coffees.  [_Frasier goes to the counter._]

speaker: Niles
text: You know I, I...  [_Niles trails off as Beth, without taking her eyes from his, dips her biscotti in her coffee and seductively nibbles on the end._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'll help.  [_Niles goes to Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I knew you'd panic!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm sorry, this is still a little new for me.  And besides, those two are coming on to us.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, they are very attractive, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I know!

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe we should ask them out?

speaker: Niles
text: On a date?  We just met!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good point, Niles!  Perhaps we should go out with them a few more times before we ask them on a date!

speaker: Niles
text: I just mean it seems a little rash.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's exactly why we should do it. [_picks up coffees_] We're being spontaneous today.  Come on.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I am enjoying this... er, all right, I'll do it.  Oh, oh, wait.  We're making an assumption here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Niles
text: We could both we interested in the same woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, I hadn't thought of that.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I'll declare.  I'm interested in Beth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good!  Good, we really dodged the bullet there. [_pause_] Which one's Beth?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's this one here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great!  [_Frasier and Niles go to the table._]  [_Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Beth & Niles and Frasier & Laura enter the apartment_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.

speaker: Laura
text: Oh, Frasier, what a great apartment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's just a little something I threw together.  You know, an objet here, an antique there.

speaker: Beth
text: [_notices Martin's chair_] And there's the chair.  Wow, he wasn't kidding!

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters_] Oh, hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, meet Beth Armstrong and Laura Paris.  [_They greet each other._]

speaker: Martin
text: Please, have a seat, sit down. [_they do_] So, you've been out on a double date, huh?

speaker: Beth
text: Well, sort of.  We met this afternoon and the next thing we knew, your sons were taking us out to dinner and then to the Seattle Rep.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, what did you see?

speaker: Laura
text: "The Man Who Came To Dinner."  It's about a bad-tempered invalid that moves into these people's house and just drives them crazy.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, comedy?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enters with brandy on tray_] I used to think so!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Mr. Smart Alec, as a matter of fact, I was just about to do a favour for you.  Sherry and I can't make it to the mountains this weekend and the cabin's already paid for, so I thought maybe you'd like to use it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, dad, but Laura and I have plans to go to the symphony.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, how about you, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Beth and I are attending an art opening.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you hear of anybody.  Nice meeting you, ladies. I'm really glad the boys brought you over.  And it's been a long time since I said that and meant it!  [_Martin exits to his room as they pick up their brandies._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, dad wasn't really thrilled with the women we married.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, fortunately my taste has improved a lot since then.

speaker: Laura
text: [_suggestive_] I think your taste is fabulous. [_pause_] I'm referring to the brandy, of course.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking into his glass_] Hmm, velvety texture, great body... I'm not. [_Laura smiles at him_]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, in honour of what happened today - a toast to winging it!  What greater thrill is there than going down an unknown path, not quite sure where it will lead, just enjoying the way that path winds, and what it looks like, and where it goes off to... er.....

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps you should have left a trail of breadcrumbs before you started down that toast!

speaker: Laura
text: You know, Frasier, I'd hate to see you miss a weekend in the country just to take me to the symphony, we can go next week.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe that... I have a thought.  In the spirit of spontaneity that has carried us this far - why don't we postpone our plans are all go to the cabin together this weekend?

speaker: Laura
text: I'd love that.

speaker: Beth
text: Sounds like fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, it's settled.  Saturday morning we ride the high country!

speaker: Niles
text: Say, you two have been here five minutes and you haven't seen Frasier's kitchen yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's really nothing special about it.

speaker: Niles
text: Let's let the professionals judge that.

speaker: Laura
text: I am kind of curious to take a peek.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, peek away.  [_The girls get up and head to the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: And some day when you speak of his faux granite countertops - and you will - be kind.

speaker: Beth
text: [_stops to look at him_] You are SO funny.  [_Beth and Laura exit to the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What's going on?!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, things are going rather fast.  ust going out this evening was a big step, but something that involves packing a suitcase, and given my situation, I can't...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  When you are going to stop letting Maris be an anchor on your social life?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, surely that is the most tortured metaphor you've ever come up with!  Maris, an anchor?!  [_They argue about this._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Even if she's lightweight... For God's sake, oh would you just stop it, you're changing the subject!  This afternoon, for the first time in your life, a perfectly lovely woman that you don't even know has agreed to go away with you on a weekend.  Isn't that exactly the kind of scenario you've always dreamed of?  [_Niles thinks about it, and is unable to keep from smiling._]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: And if you pass it up, won't you regret it?

speaker: Niles
text: [_more energetic_] Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well then, for once in your timid, risk-free life, don't you think it's time you grabbed that brass ring?  [_The girls enter._]

speaker: Laura
text: Great kitchen, Frasier!  You guys feel like firing up the cappuccino maker?

speaker: Niles
text: [_with gusto_] _Yes!_ [_pause_] Of course, if I have that much caffine at this hour, it'll probably make me... [_Frasier hits him_] YES!!!  [_End of Act One_]  [_Act Two_]  **LET'S VUITTON WITH IT**  [_Scene One - Cabin. Frasier, Niles, Laura & Beth enter the cabin with their luggage._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, here we are.

speaker: Laura
text: Oh, this place is perfect.

speaker: Beth
text: Don't you just love this air?  Oh, I am going to sleep like a baby.

speaker: Laura
text: Me too.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hope you don't mind roughing it.  There's no radio or television.

speaker: Laura
text: I guess we'll just have to make our own entertainment!

speaker: Beth
text: We should be able to manage that.  Come on, let's go look around outside.

speaker: Niles
text: We'll start the fire and we'll be right out.

speaker: Beth
text: Okay.  [_Beth and Laura exit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think things are going rather well, don't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes they are, and thank you for twisting my arm.

speaker: Frasier
text: You feel like a new man, don't you?

speaker: Niles
text: I feel like a new woman, and thank God I remembered to pack one! [_they laugh_] Ah, you know, I just wish I were sure that Beth and I were on the same page.  It's been so long, I've forgotten how to read all the signals.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Niles, you don't need a decoder ring to understand the phrase, "Make our own entertainment"!

speaker: Niles
text: [_naughty chuckle_] No-o!  [_The boys laugh._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Then again, there was that other statement about sleeping like a baby.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly!  They could be thinking platonic.  The two of them in one room, sleeping like babies.

speaker: Frasier
text: The two of us in another, crying like babies.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we're all adults, I suppose we could just ask them what they have in mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the worst thing we could do!  What if they're not interested?  They'll be embarrassed and it'll ruin the entire weekend.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I know!  Their luggage will tell us!  We'll put my bag in with your date's, and your bag in with my date's. They'll see the mistake, and the way they correct it will tell us with whom they're planning to spend the night - each other, or us - and either way, it'll all look like a simple misunderstanding.

speaker: Frasier
text: You've done this before!

speaker: Niles
text: Only on my honeymoon, now hurry!  [_Frasier and Niles go about this operation._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, this is idiotic!  We're both trained psychiatrists.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and finally it's paying off!  [_Laura and Beth enter._]

speaker: Laura
text: Oh, Frasier, this place is heaven.

speaker: Beth
text: Why don't we open up a bottle of wine and watch the sunset?

speaker: Niles
text: You know, the sun won't be setting for a little while yet. Just think how much more we'll enjoy it if we got all our unpacking done first!

speaker: Beth
text: That can wait.

speaker: Laura
text: Er, by the way, Beth and I were talking, and I don't know what you guys have in mind for tonight and sorry if this sounds kind of forward, but we would like to avoid an awkward, uncomfortable situation by getting this out in the open right now.  [_The boys are hopeful._]

speaker: Laura
text: When we go out to dinner tonight, it's on us.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_let down_] Well, that's awfully nice of you.  Speaking of awkwardness... er, did you know....

speaker: Niles
text: Look at that sunset!  [_The girls go to the window._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you as crazed by this as I am?

speaker: Niles
text: It's driving me out of my mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right!  I'm going to settle this once and for all. Now, just follow my lead.  [_Frasier and Niles walk up to the window with the girls._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, now that is lovely, isn't it?  [_Frasier puts his arm around Laura's waist, she snuggles up to him._]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, it is magnificent.  [_Niles puts his arm around Beth's, she snuggles up to him.  The boys lean back behind the girls and exchange faces that say, "Bingo!"  However, Laura and Beth then put their arms around each other, like friends.  The boys lean back again with faces that say, "Now what?!"_]  [_Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne is sat with a towel over her head, on the couch, over a bowl of hot water as Martin enters and sits on his chair with a beer._]

speaker: Martin
text: Not feeling so hot, huh?  [_Daphne sits up and gives him an evil look._]

speaker: Martin
text: What did the doctor say?

speaker: Daphne
text: He says I've got... Oh, what was that medical term he used? Oh, I remember; flu!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm really sorry I didn't let you get that flu shot.  Is there anything at all that I can do for you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, when I was a little girl and got sick, Grammy Moon used to read me to sleep.  It's a great comfort.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh. [_picks up book_] Is this what you're reading?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: "The Rose And The Rapier"?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, if you're not in the mood... [_sneezes, coughs violently and then sprays a breath freshener into her mouth_] You don't have to.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, I'll do it.

speaker: Daphne
text: The bookmark's where I left off.  [_Daphne relaxes on the sofa._] [_N.B. "The Rose & the Rapier" is the novel written by Deirdre Sauvage, the romance novelist from "The Adventures of Bad Boy and Dirty Girl."_]

speaker: Martin
text: All right.  Okay. [_reads_] "With a gasp of dismay, she ran to him, her amethyst eyes wide with alarm.  'You fool,' she hissed, 'Suppose someone saw you.  The Duke's men are everywhere'." [_looks up_] Hey, this isn't so bad.

speaker: Daphne
text: I told you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_reads_] "'You fool,' she whispered again, 'You sweet, brave, wonderful fool.  I should have died had you not found my bedchamber.'" [_suddenly embarrassed_] Oh, Geez! [_reads_] "Then she was in his arms and all her qualms forgotten as she... [_shifts in chair_] ...tore his tunic asunder and thrust her eager lips against the sinews of his naked chest."  [_Martin looks over to Daphne who seems to be asleep.  He turns some pages._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_reads_] "The next morning..."

speaker: Daphne
text: You left out a section!

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, okay! [_goes back, reads_] "As his brazen fingers peeled the silken fabric from her heaving... [_coughs the word "bosum" out as he turns red_] ...he beheld her quivering alabaster mounds. [_takes a huge gulp of his beer to wet his suddenly dry throat_] At that moment she felt the proof of his rampant passion... [_he sweeps his forehead of sweat_] against her milky thighs.  His almost God-like beauty was marred only...  [_Martin looks over to a sleeping Daphne._]

speaker: Martin
text: ...by the fact that he was..." [_closes book_] cross-eyed, three feet tall and had breath like owl droppings!  [_Martin looks over to Daphne who is obviously dead to the world, he looks content._]  [_Scene Three - Cabin. That evening, Frasier, Niles, Laura and Beth are sat by the fire with glasses of wine._]

speaker: Laura
text: Is there anything more relaxing than just lazing by the fire with a good glass of wine?

speaker: Beth
text: Nothing I know of.

speaker: Niles
text: You two must be relaxed.  Sitting there so calmly when there is still all that unpacking to do.

speaker: Beth
text: Oh Niles, we didn't bring that much.

speaker: Laura
text: Yeah, we didn't think we'd need too many clothes this weekend!  [_Frasier and Niles look at each other wondering if this was a hint._]

speaker: Laura
text: Well, I hate to break things up but I'm getting a little sleepy, so I'm going to get ready for bed.

speaker: Beth
text: Yeah, it is getting kinda late. [_to Frasier, re: wine glass_] Are you finished with that?  [_Frasier hands over the glass as Beth goes to the kitchen.  Laura, meanwhile, goes to a bedroom.  Niles and Frasier meet in the middle._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, this is tearing me apart!

speaker: Niles
text: These women are inscrutable as sphinxes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, they've got us into some most veiled, cloaked, cryptic messages. Can't they just give us one clear signal?!

speaker: Beth
text: [_crossing the room_] Well, I'm off to bed.  Niles, are you coming?  [_Beth exits to another bedroom._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_not realising_] Curse these infernal riddles!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_realises_] So she really said what I thought she said?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, go!

speaker: Niles
text: Suitcase!  Suitcase!  [_The boys exchange cases._]

speaker: Niles
text: There you are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sleep well.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you too.  [_Frasier notices Niles pick up his mobile phone and dial._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, never mind. [_into phone_] Yes, is Mrs. Crane there?  Yes, I'll hold.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is this, some sort of weird, kinky foreplay?!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm starting to feel guilty about this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now?!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I just need to clarify the ground rules of Maris's and my separation.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, fine, fine.  I think you might look back on this one day as your darkest hour.  But, do what you want to.  [_Frasier exits to the bedroom where Laura is waiting._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone_] Yes, Maris.  Er, it occurred to me, we never laid out the rules about our dating other people and what we could and couldn't do.

speaker: Beth
text: [_o.s._] Niles, what are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: [_covers phone_] Coming. [_into phone_] I, er, well, here's the thing: I know that we're allowed to see other people.  Em, my question is, how much of them are we allowed to see?  [_The door to his room opens.  Beth stands in the doorway in a nightie in which Niles can see all.  She beckons him._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_reeling slightly, holds up a finger, whispering:_] Be with you in a second. [_she smiles and goes back in; into phone_] I'm sorry, what?  Oh, really?  Well, that's wonderful, that's all I needed to know.  Thank you.  [_Niles hangs up and knocks on Frasier's door.  Frasier opens the door looking rather angry.  His shirt is half unbuttoned_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: You were wrong.  Maris says she doesn't mind at all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah!  Well then, off you go!  [_Frasier exits back to his room._]

speaker: Niles
text: Let the revels begin!  [_Niles takes the bottle of wine and himself into Beth's room. However, he isn't in there two seconds before Niles re-enters the main room, still with the wine, and goes to knock on Frasier's door. Frasier answers it, with more anger, this time his whole shirt is unbuttoned and he is starting to undo his trouser belt._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Niles
text: Why doesn't Maris mind at all?

speaker: Laura
text: [_o.s_] What's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, nothing, just a second, it's Niles.  I'll be a moment. [_then, to Niles_] Why do you care?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, because she could have taken a lover herself and this is her way of alleviating her guilt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, Niles, so what do you want to do?  Do you want to stew over that all night - let her have all the fun?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, no, of course not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then - [_with somewhat less oomph_] Off you go!  [_Frasier watches as Niles takes the wine bottle up to Beth's room, kicks the door open with his feet, and enters in macho pride.  Frasier retires back to his room.  The room is dark.  However, Niles's mobile starts ringing in the room.  Niles comes out again._]

speaker: Beth
text: [_o.s_] Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Er, momentito.  [_Niles answers his phone._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?  Yes, Maris.  Oh, I see, but... all right.  [_Niles hangs up, confused.  He then, once again, knocks on Frasier's door.  This time he is wearing only his boxers_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!!

speaker: Laura
text: [_o.s_] Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll just be a second.

speaker: Niles
text: She changed her mind, she doesn't want me to go through with this.  Do you realise what's happening here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  Your ex-wife is ruining my sex life!  Give me that!  [_Frasier snatches Niles's phone.  However it starts ringing again. This makes Frasier extremely mad as he moves towards the front door._]

speaker: Niles
text: Could I... What are you doing?  [_Frasier opens the door and throws it out as it stops ringing. He closes the door._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_shocked_] What are you doing?  What if she's changed her mind again, how I am supposed to know what to think?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just going to say this one last time.  This weekend is not about thinking, it's about doing.  Doing something that the Crane boys haven't done for a very, very long time!  For once in our miserable, sex-starved lives, can't we do something pleasurable without thinking it to death?!  [_Unaware to the boys, Laura and Beth enter the room._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't think about today, don't think about what's right! Don't even think of them as Laura and Beth! [_Laura crosses her arms_] For tonight they are just two live, breathing, available female bodies who want us!

speaker: Laura
text: Think again!  [_Niles and Frasier turn around in shock to see Laura and Beth exiting to the two separate bedroom, slamming the doors behind them.  Frasier gives Niles a look.  However, this gets worse when we hear Niles's mobile phone resonating from outside.  Niles opens the door and looks out._]

speaker: Niles
text: Do you remember which snow bank you threw my phone into?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I think I could hit it again! [_seizes him by the shirt_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  Frasier!  Frasier!  [_Frasier pushes Niles out of the door._]  [_End of Act Two_]
